column1: #Text=DS : How do you break your novel out ?
#Text=How do you get it to stand apart ?
#Text=I ca n't think about it that way .
#Text=It 's very simple : All I do is write .
#Text=The way that I go about doing my work is very simple .
#Text=Imagine that somebody told you that some book was great , or a movie was great , or a play was great , but they did n't tell you anything about it .
#Text=You 're on your way there to see it or hear it or read it , and in your mind , you 're already imagining what it 's going to be like .
#Text=I write the stuff that I wish were up there because I 'm so often disappointed .
#Text=I 'm just trying to write the thing that would make me happy , you know , as if it was an audience of a hundred thousand of me out there , what they want to read .
#Text=That is n't necessarily what everybody does .
#Text=Although I think any successful writer has to be enthusiastic about their own writing .
#Text=But you might be writing in terms of , "

#Text=Oh this is going to be my big blockbuster novel  or something .
